page.title: 02Lastingham Village
page.content: All three villages were mentioned in the{Domesday Survey}of 1086. The 3 wells in Lastingham are dedicated to St. Cedd,who built the Monastery in 654 AD,St. Chad,his brother who became Abbot on Cedd's death,& St.Ovin who helped Chad to spread christianity. The unique Norman crypt was built on the old Monastery site by Stephen of Whitby in 1078 to house the remains of St.Cedd. This is today the foundation of the present church of St.Marys. Jackson bridge commemorates John Jackson,an 18th Century portrait painter who was born here. Over the past 20 years much renovation of the 18th & 19th Century cottages has been done,mostly by people retiring to the village. There is a general store with post office,an inn,a licensed restaurant,a small guest house & an hotel.
